body:
@dlsniper 
> Vagueness everywhere

I just don't want to enter again into details that I have explained in some of my posts above, several times.
But the diamond dependency problem that cabal (one of Haskell's package manager) suffered stems a lot from packages importing libraries at different **major** versions level.

major version meaning breaking change.

If you only allow minor version changes, you will not suffer from this problem (or at least, it is solvable fairly easily).

Breaking API should be no joke. And I don't want some library I depend on, breaking its API contract under my feet without me knowing it. You want to change your API ? Fine. Make another package and let me decide whether I want to migrate or not.

> Assumption is the mother of all issues

I meant assumption as in "mathematical" assumption
